head.supplied: Melbourne, 13th April 1889 ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you that, in accordance with approved requisitions, tenders are called for a fence around the Botanic Museum in yesterday's Government Gazett...

div.p: M89/5327, unit 427, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
MS written by Georg Luehmann and signed by M. Melbourne, 13th April 1889

I have the honor to inform you that, in accordance with approved requisitions, tenders are called for a fence around the Botanic Museum in yesterday's Government Gazette by the Dept. of Public Works.
get details and x-ref.
I know desire to draw your attention to the fact that the Domain, in which the Museum is situated, is under the control of the Department of Lands, and it may therefore be necessary to communicate with the Honorable the Minister of Lands in regard to this fence — even if only for form's sake, as the ground surrounding the Botanic Museum has always been considered as belonging to it. The area proposed to be enclosed is about one (1) acre.
H. Moors, for the Under Secretary, forwarded M's letter to the Secretary for Lands who replied on 9 May: 'There is no objection to the erection of this fence on the part of this Department.' The file was forwarded to M for his 'information' and he returned it 'with best thanks' on 11 May.
